newsitem.title: LATVIA: Latvian shares gain slightly, market trade down.
newsitem.headline: Latvian shares gain slightly, market trade down.

text.p: Latvian shares gained slightly on Wednesday although overall market turnover was a touch lower, the stock exchange said.
The market traded 113,000 lats of shares and the Rietumu Bank market index gained 0.62 percent to 151.46. Saules Bank's Saule10 index climbed 0.08 percent to 152.32.
The most traded stock was Unibanka on turnover of 44,700 lats as it remained stable at 3.24 lats.
Riga Transport Fleet traded 8,100 lats and was one santime higher at 1.70 lats while Staburadze was unchanged at 2.53 lats as it turned over 12,900 lats.
On the secondary list, Kaija fish cannery saw activity of 14,600 lats and was unchanged at 2.21 lats while Daugavpils Chain added four santimes to 2.25 lats on 14,500 lats.
Mangali Shipyard fell two santimes to 1.05 lats on turnover of 4,000 lats and Roja fish cannery traded 3,300 lats and rose to 3.25 lats from 2.83 lats.
The Lode Brick company was also active on turnover of 2,900 lats and climbed six santimes to 2.06 lats.
